required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Using Boot Camp Translation to Address Rural Disparities in Adolescent Vaccination
clinical_study.official_title: Using Boot Camp Translation to Address Rural Disparities in Adolescent Vaccination

collaborator.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: The overall goal of this project is to implement the Boot Camp Translation process to develop a replicable approach for increasing adolescent vaccine uptake that can be adaptable and feasible to use in rural settings more broadly.

detailed_description.textblock:
Boot Camp Translation (BCT) is a process to identify strategies that help communities improve health. It is a 6-month, facilitated, iterative community engagement process that brings together relevant stakeholders to develop and implement locally meaningful messages, materials, and strategies for health topics of interest.
This is a novel community engagement process that has a proven ability to result in meaningful and impactful strategies to improve compliance with recommended health behaviors in rural communities. The investigators will expand this work by testing BCT on its ability to improve vaccination with all recommend adolescent vaccines (Tdap, MenACWY, HPV, Flu).
The investigators will conduct a randomized, controlled trial in which 4 rural communities in Western Colorado will undergo BCT to develop and implement strategies to increase adolescent vaccination. Vaccination rates will be compared to 4 control communities that do not undergo BCT.

study_design_info.masking_description: The study team data analyst will be provided with blinded data.

primary_outcome.measure: Initiation of HPV vaccination series, 11-12 year olds
primary_outcome.description: Percent of 11-12 year olds who have received >=1 dose of the HPV vaccine by May 31,2021

secondary_outcome.measure: Completion of HPV vaccination series, 11-12 year olds
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of 11-12 year olds with >=2 doses of the HPV vaccine by May 31,2021

secondary_outcome.measure: Initiation of HPV vaccination series, 13-17 year olds
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of 13-17 year olds who have received >=1 dose of the HPV vaccine by May 31,2021

secondary_outcome.measure: Completion of HPV vaccination series, 13-17 year olds
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of 13-17 year olds who have completed the HPV vaccine series (2 or 3 doses, depending on age of initiation) by May 31,2021

secondary_outcome.measure: Receipt of Tdap vaccine, 11-12 year olds
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of 11-12 year olds who have received Tdap vaccine by May 31,2021

secondary_outcome.measure: Receipt of Tdap vaccine, 13-17 year olds
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of 13-17 year olds who have received Tdap vaccine by May 31,2021

secondary_outcome.measure: Receipt of MCV vaccine, 11-12 year olds
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of 11-12 year olds who have received >=1 dose of MCV vaccine by May 31,2021

secondary_outcome.measure: Receipt of MCV vaccine, 13-17 year olds
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of 13-17 year olds who have received >=1 dose of MCV vaccine by May 31,2021

other_outcome.description: Percent of 11-17 year olds who receive the influenza vaccine between Sept 2020 and May 2021

arm_group.description: Intervention communities will undergo the Boot Camp Translation process.
Control communities will behave as usual

intervention.description: Communities in the intervention arm will participate in the Boot Camp translation process, where stakeholders will come together to develop and implement locally relevant materials to promote adolescent vaccination.
No intervention. Communities will continue to behave as usual.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must live in one of the designated Colorado communities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Does not live in one of the designated Colorado communities

facility.name: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
